pageContext.claim: “What’s been proven to happen, is when you do that [raise the minimum wage], these small businesses fire many of their employees.”
pageContext.analysis: Some research does support that claim — but it’s far from “proven.” The Congressional Budget Office concluded that raising the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour would boost the wages of 17 million workers and lift 1.3 million out of poverty — but at a cost of around 1.3 million low-wage jobs. But that was a highly uncertain figure. CBO calculated that the odds are 2 in 3 that the loss of jobs would be somewhere between “about zero” and 3.7 million.
